Hi Lucy, 

Confirming we have actioned the below changes. Please have a look and let us know your thoughts. 

Have a great weekend.

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Jaime Velasquez

full_threads.body: @jaime can you please try and do this ticket? Thanks

Heath,

Apologies - I realised I didn't provide the original images of the screenshots below - most have all been pulled from the website so should be in the back end but let me know if you need me to package these up and send these? The attached should be the only one that you don't yet have access to.

Thanks!

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hey Heath,

Have some initial comments on the new homepage (have labelled the sections at the bottom of this email for you) -

https://acoufelt.com/au/home-new/

Section 1: Am trying to simplify this and include more minimalistic but colour-coordinated images - can we instead reduce and update to the following

Can we have all overlaying text increase in size and also 'stuck' to each image.

Could we also make this section slightly shorter/narrower?

  1. Acoufelt is all about Making Quiet™ in shared spaces for better working, learning and living. (can we have this text 'stuck' to the image')



2. Our Acoustic FWC™ Philosophy looks at all six surfaces in a room, the floor, four walls and the ceiling. The starting point is the floor. (View carpet collections)



3. Our ceiling baffle collection is available in 3 shapes: Linear, Ripple, and Wing, and offered across our full range of colourways. (View baffle collection)



4. Wherever you are working, we want you to be comfortable carrying out business as usual. Make your space your own with Acoufelt's range of Mobile Acoustics. (View table dividers)



Section 2:

Update images to:

Shapes - OK



Desk solutions - OK



Bafles - OK



Change clouds to:



Change Screens to:



Change Mobile acoustics to:

Section 3: Keep these images for time-being (might reconsider after we nail colour palette), but can we insert overlay text with project names for context? Also maybe can we reduce the size of the section as well?

Section 4: Can we move this up so that it's sitting between section 1 and 2. I am working on a visual for this to replace straight blanket text over coloured box.

Add section 5: At bottom can we include some News items here with picture and News heading - I'd pick the following to display (happy for this to mimick how we've displayed products in a row as above):

https://acoufelt.com/acoufelt-joins-material-bank-for-fast-and-sustainable-sampling/

https://acoufelt.com/ceo-message-on-covid-19/

https://acoufelt.com/spotlight-on-pixel-panels/

Thanks!



Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hey Heath,

I agree - it's getting complicated isn't it. Your 'mood board' approach could certainly work - I'd like to propose this to the team. Without creating a tonne of extra work for you on top of what you've done, is there any chance you could mock up a condensed version of what you had in mind for this page for one of the colours so that I could present this to the team for comment? Alternatively, let's schedule in a call to discuss our options if you had another idea in mind. I agree with your thoughts and am concerned about making this function scalable with the rate that we're adding products and new colours.

Thanks Heath!

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hi Lucy, 

Wow ok - that does change things. We would end up with a heap of product on each single colour page... Almost to the extent that the whole approach may be counter productive. 

What if we take a slightly different approach and create a landing page for each of the colours lists below. It would be almost like a stylised mood board of ideas with some actual product images/swatches and some real installation images. It would be more of a 'this is what you can achieve with our product' versus here is all of our [red] products. This will make it scalable. The primary purpose of this section would pivot from a 'search' tool and be more of a 'your options are endless' scenario. 

Happy to have a chat about this further if you like?

Hey Heath,

Understand your approach with the core colours and having Weave and Carpet tiles etc fall within these colour categories. Just to complicate matters further, we are about to launch another 12 core colours to our FilaSorb/panel ranges - these new colours are a mix of greens, purples, yellows etc. Am almost wondering whether we need to condense and simplify these colours to:

Whites

Creams
Greys

Black

Blues

Navy

Green

Yellow

Orange

Purple

What do you think about this and is this workable?

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

Hi Lucy, 

Thanks for the update. Regarding the colour search questions:

  • Noted regarding pixel, we will add them in using the primary colourway i.e. not the little pixel colour
  • Regarding the classification of colours, we are thinking that we could use the solid colourways as the 'core colours' and then associate the carpet tiles and weave colours to these core colours. Would that work for you? We essentially need a way to categorise the colours to limit the choices for the user. 
  • Regarding an excel spread sheet, yes the idea would be to list the core colours and then indicate which carpet tiles and weaves should be shown on their respective pages. I hope that makes sense?

Thanks for this update Heath and team -

Am currently working on pulling together some feedback on the new homepage. Hope to have some comments across by tomorrow.

The colour search function is looking great - obviously you are just needing those extra details from us on colour classifying the carpet tiles? Have also noticed that 'Pixel' is missing under Wall Panels, and 'Weave' is also now missing under both wall and ceiling (wall panels and ceiling panels)- 43 new colours to classify. Is there an excel sheet or something that we could pull together to help with classifying new products/colours for whenever we upload a new category to the website? Just thinking about how we can make this scalable.

Thanks Heath!

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Pending

full_threads.body:
Hi Lucy, 

Thanks for your patience on this. Here is an update. 

Colour Search:

We are doing a little extra spade work to get the colour search right and extendable moving forward to allow for new products. 

If you head to: https://acoufelt.com/au/search-by-colour/ You will see the colours we have loaded up so far. We are going to need some help with the carpet tiles if that's ok? Ideally we will need to know which colourways + ranges you would like to appear for each colour, as well as which image you want as the featured one (top right of the page). 

ETA: COB tomorrow + the some extra time once we have the above. 

Mega Menu + Home New

This is updated as requested and ready to review: https://acoufelt.com/au/home-new/

Let me know if you have any questions?

Hey Heath,

Just checking in on these items below? How's it all tracking? I have another big product/collection upload to forward to your team so wanting to make sure this is within your capacity for this week still?

Thanks!

Warm regards,

Lucy Pittman
Marketing Manager

t +61 1800.62.64.62 ext 310Level 4 108 King William Street Adelaide SA 5000acoufelt.com
